transcript:
silence. 
Pierre sat up on the sofa, with his legs tucked under him. 
"Really, I don't yet know. I don't like either the one or the other." 
"But you must decide on somethingl Your father expects it." 
Pierre at the age of ten had been sent a- broad with an abb as tutor, and had remained away till he was twenty. When he returned to Moscow his father dismissed the abbe 
and said to the young man, "Now go to Petersburg, look round, and choose your profession. I will agree to anything. Here is
